title: Chinese Embassy sends 30 volunteer teachers to Mauritius to teach Mandarin (Linked to Project ID#56642)
description: On November 15, 2018, the Chinese Ambassador to Mauritius, Mr. Sun Gongyi, met with Mauritian Minister of Education and Human Resources, Tertiary Education and Scientific Research, Mrs. Luchoomun, to exchange opinions on the field of education. According to the Minister, the Chinese Embassy has made arrangements to send 30 Chinese voluntary educators, for the year 2019, to teach Mandarin across primary schools in Mauritius. For the past 10 years, the Chinese government has sent 140 volunteer teachers to Mauritius, constituting a strong force in Chinese language teaching in the country.  On October 22, 2019, a farewell ceremony was held for the 30 Chinese volunteer teachers. The were issued honor certificates and gifts during the ceremony.  During the same meeting, the Chinese Embassy in Mauritius also made a donation of equipment to the Mauritius Ministry of Education and Human Resources to overall improve the Chinese language teaching capabilities of Mauritian schools (captured in Project ID#56642).
combined_text:
# Sector
EDUCATION

# Title

On November 15, 2018, the Chinese Ambassador to Mauritius, Mr. Sun Gongyi, met with Mauritian Minister of Education and Human Resources, Tertiary Education and Scientific Research, Mrs. Luchoomun, to exchange opinions on the field of education. According to the Minister, the Chinese Embassy has made arrangements to send 30 Chinese voluntary educators, for the year 2019, to teach Mandarin across primary schools in Mauritius. For the past 10 years, the Chinese government has sent 140 volunteer teachers to Mauritius, constituting a strong force in Chinese language teaching in the country.  On October 22, 2019, a farewell ceremony was held for the 30 Chinese volunteer teachers. The were issued honor certificates and gifts during the ceremony.  During the same meeting, the Chinese Embassy in Mauritius also made a donation of equipment to the Mauritius Ministry of Education and Human Resources to overall improve the Chinese language teaching capabilities of Mauritian schools (captured in Project ID#56642).
justification: Project focuses on education and language teaching without direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Sending volunteer teachers for Mandarin education, donation of educational equipment

title: Chinese Embassy donates Chinese tutoring materials and traditional Chinese musical instruments to the Huaxia Chinese School, Xinhua Chinese School, and Guangming Chinese School in Mauritius (Linked to Project ID#85642)
description: On February 10, 2018, the Chinese Embassy in Mauritius held a handover ceremony for a donation of Chinese tutoring materials and traditional Chinese musical instruments to three Chinese schools of Mauritius, Xinhua, Huaxia, and Guangming. The donation was provided by the Overseas Chinese Affairs Office of the State Council. The ceremony was attended by the political counselor of the embassy Gong Yufeng and the head of Huaxia Chinese School, Liang Meiyun. The purpose of the donation was to improve Chinese language education and Chinese culture development within Mauritius. The monetary value of the donation is unknown.  In 2020, a similar donation of teaching equipment was made to the same three Mauritian schools (captured by Project ID#85642).
combined_text:

title: Chinese Hanban (Confucius Institute) sends 19 public teachers and volunteers to improve Chinese Language Teaching Institutes in Mauritius
description: On January 4, 2018, 19 public teachers and volunteers sent by the Chinese Hanban (Confucius Institute) arrived in Mauritius. They will be improving Chinese Language Teaching in Mauritius as a part of a bilateral agreement between China and Mauritius. They will teach at primary schools according to the Chinese Embassy in Mauritius.  This volunteer program is part of a larger program started in 2015 through a bilateral agreement between Mauritius and China. This is the fourth batch of teachers to arrive in Mauritius from China.
combined_text:
# Sector
EDUCATION

# Title

# Description
On January 4, 2018, 19 public teachers and volunteers sent by the Chinese Hanban (Confucius Institute) arrived in Mauritius. They will be improving Chinese Language Teaching in Mauritius as a part of a bilateral agreement between China and Mauritius. They will teach at primary schools according to the Chinese Embassy in Mauritius.  This volunteer program is part of a larger program started in 2015 through a bilateral agreement between Mauritius and China. This is the fourth batch of teachers to arrive in Mauritius from China.
justification: Project focuses on education and cultural exchange without direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Chinese language teaching program, education sector focus, cultural exchange initiative

title: Chinese Embassy donates office supplies to the Headquarters of the Mauritian Police
description: On August 14, 2018, the Chinese Embassy in Mauritius donated some office supplies to the Mauritius Police Headquarters, and a donation ceremony was held. The donation was in gratitude for the Mauritian Police's assistance during President Xi Jinping's visit in July. The ceremony was attended by Mauritius Police Chief Connaught and Counselor Song Yanqun. The specific materials donated and the value of the donation is unknown.
combined_text:
# Sector
GOVERNMENT AND CIVIL SOCIETY

# Title

justification: Project involves donation of office supplies to government institution with no clear environmental or energy transition impact

title: China finances two seminars on 'Capability of Leadership for Ministerial Officials of the African Union' worth Rs 146,474 for Mauritius
description: According to the Treasury of the Mauritius government, on September 3, 2018, China financed two seminars on the "Capability of leadership for Ministerial Officials of the African Union" to the Mauritian Ministry of Civil Service and Administrative Reforms. These seminars had an estimated value of Rs 146,474. The donation has been received; however, no information can be found on the implementation process of the seminar.

title: China holds a seminar on 'Town Infrastructure Construction and Management of Inland Regions for Developing Countries' worth Rs 105,000 for Mauritius
description: According to the Treasury of the Mauritius government, on August 7, 2018, China donated foreign aid for a seminar on "Town Infrastructure Construction and Management of Inland Regions for Developing Countries" worth Rs 105,000 for the Ministry of Public Infrastructure & Land Transport. 3 seminars were held on this topic according to the Mauritius Department of Treasury Foreign Aid document. According to the Annual Report for the Road Development Authority, up to 65 staff members attended this seminar for professional development.
combined_text:
# Sector
INDUSTRY, MINING, CONSTRUCTION

# Title
China holds a seminar on 'Town Infrastructure Construction and Management of Inland Regions for Developing Countries' worth Rs 105,000 for Mauritius

# Description
According to the Treasury of the Mauritius government, on August 7, 2018, China donated foreign aid for a seminar on "Town Infrastructure Construction and Management of Inland Regions for Developing Countries" worth Rs 105,000 for the Ministry of Public Infrastructure & Land Transport. 3 seminars were held on this topic according to the Mauritius Department of Treasury Foreign Aid document. According to the Annual Report for the Road Development Authority, up to 65 staff members attended this seminar for professional development.
justification: Project is focused on knowledge sharing and professional development through seminars, with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Seminar on town infrastructure construction and management, professional development for staff members
